item.title: Pamela add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All his life he tried to be a good person. Many times, however, he failed. For after all, he was only human. He wasn't a dog." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Johnny Depp
item.description: "The only creatures that are evolved enough to convey pure love are dogs and infants." -- Johnny Depp

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Carrie Underwood
item.description: "The more boys I meet the more I love my dog." -- Carrie Underwood

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Andy Rooney
item.description: "The average dog is a nicer person than the average person." -- Andy Rooney

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Cesar Millan
item.description: "I believe in integrity. Dogs have it. Humans are sometimes lacking it." -- Cesar Millan

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Linda McCartney
item.description: "If slaughterhouses had glass walls, the whole world would be vegetarian." -- Linda McCartney

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Caroline Knapp
item.description: "The dog’s agenda is simple, fathomable, overt: I want. “I want to go out, come in, eat something, lie here, play with that, kiss you. There are no ulterior motives with a dog, no mind games, no second-guessing, no complicated negotiations or bargains, and no guilt trips or grudges if a request is denied." -- Caroline Knapp

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Samuel Butler
item.description: "The greatest pleasure of a dog is that you may make a fool of yourself with him, and not only will he not scold you, but he will make a fool of himself, too." -- Samuel Butler

item.title: Pamela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I've seen a look in dogs' eyes, a quickly vanishing look of amazed contempt, and I am convinced that basically dogs think humans are nuts." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "Everything I know, I learned from dogs." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Coraline opened the box of chocolates. The dog looked at them longingly. "Would you like one?" she asked the little dog. "Yes, please," whispered the dog. "Only not toffee ones. They make me drool." "I thought chocolates weren't very good for dogs," she said, remembering something Miss Forcible had once told her. "Maybe where you come from," whispered the little dog. "Here, it's all we eat." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "Men are like dogs," Stacy was fond of saying. And she usually went on to add that, like dogs, they all took up too much space on the bed, and they always went for the crotch." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Martha Gellhorn
item.description: "I know enough to know that no woman should ever marry a man who hated his mother." -- Martha Gellhorn

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There's no bitch on earth like a mother frightened for her kids." -- Stephen King

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "It took me a long time to realise that there are two kinds of writing; the one you write and the one that writes you. The one that writes you is dangerous. You go where you don’t want to go. You look where you don’t want to look." -- Jeanette Winterson
